user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_Posix_CompAbsDelayTime:
```c
void OS_Posix_CompAbsDelayTime(uint32 msecs, struct timespec *tm)
{
    clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME, tm);

    /* add the delay to the current time */
    tm->tv_sec += (time_t)(msecs / 1000);
    /* convert residue ( msecs )  to nanoseconds */
    tm->tv_nsec += (msecs % 1000) * 1000000L;

    if (tm->tv_nsec >= 1000000000L)
    {
        tm->tv_nsec -= 1000000000L;
        tm->tv_sec++;
    }
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No statically unreachable code fragments were found in the function. Every statement is reachable from function entry: there is no early return, no infinite loop that prevents subsequent code, no goto/jump skipping code, and no code following a guaranteed non-returning call. The if (tm->tv_nsec >= 1000000000L) branch is conditional (and therefore potentially reachable depending on inputs) so it is not unreachable. The call to clock_gettime, the subsequent arithmetic on tm->tv_sec and tm->tv_nsec, and the conditional normalization are all reachable at runtime. 

Notes for investigators (not flagged as unreachable): ensure callers never pass a null tm (null dereference is undefined behavior, not unreachable code) and verify type ranges/time_t/tv_nsec representation to avoid signed overflow/implementation-defined behavior, but these are correctness/safety concerns rather than evidence of unreachable code under MISRA C Rule 2.1.
